summary: Sansa, the angel of death. It's really funny to see how many people have loved, protected, coveted, used and abused Sansa. Most...
caption:
Sansa, the angel of death.

It’s really funny to see how many people have loved, protected, coveted, used and abused Sansa. Most are dead now, she survived them all.

There is also Tywin, who talks a lot about Sansa, marries her to Tyrion and wants his son to sleep with her. Missandei gets angry after Sansa and she dies the next episode. Jaime was released to save Sansa, she was his sister-in-law, he gives Brienne a sword to protect her. Episode 4, Sansa gives Jaime the information that will make him die.
Now only remains Daenerys, as Sansa’s enemy, Tyrion, who betrayed her trust, the last of the Starks and Brienne. We’ll see. Her list may not be over yet.

Like Tyrion said: “Lady Sansa, you may will survive us yet.”

summary: When and if you truly love someone and you disagree with her, you argue with her, scream at her, you get angry because you would...
body:
When and if you truly love someone and you disagree with her, you argue with her, scream at her, you get angry because you would like the most important person to you to think like you, to support you, understand your reasons.

YOU DON’T go along with her just for the sake of it. YOU DON’T bow your head (cough bend the knee) or have that kind of troubled expression. YOU DON’T get threaten. You both compromise.

Love is mutual respect, loyalty, devotion, passion and trust. You want to protect each other. You’re afraid for her, not of her.

Love is mutual respect, loyalty, devotion, passion and trust. You want to protect each other. You’re afraid for her, not of her.

tags: If you are a d*ny stan this is not the post for you
it is tagged anti for a reason guys
summary: D*ny:  Brings three grown dragons to conquer Westeros. Uses said dragons in battle to burn soldiers alive.  Burns food wagons. ...
body:
D*ny:

  • Brings three grown dragons to conquer Westeros.
  • Uses said dragons in battle to burn soldiers alive.
  • Burns food wagons.
  • Burns alive a defeated Lord and his heir for refusing to kneel.

Also D*ny:

“Why are not people rioting and trying to murder Cersei and begging me to be their Queen?”

“It must be Sansa’s fault!”

blog.name: samaraclegane
blog.title: fem
blog.description: caroline dhavernas is my wife. always feel free to send me prompts!

summary: Idk what to do with this sansan scene but I've been focused on Arya's observational skills and how there is no way she would not...
question: Idk what to do with this sansan scene but I've been focused on Arya's observational skills and how there is no way she would not have known of the connection between her sister and Sandor. I HC that Arya is able to persuade Sandor to abandon his mission, as he did with her, by mentioning Sansa and particularly that she has carried his cloak with her all the years they've been parted, and basically just convinces him that his feelings aren't one sided, and that the fire will get Gregor anyway.
answer:
author’s note: pretty much taken from the actual scene, only with your prompt inserted! thanks for sending me this detailed idea anon, super lovely to imagine. the cloak!! of course Arya would learn of the cloak and piece it all together!! I’d have loved to watch her play cupid with these two, shame it won’t happen. hope you enjoy! :)

-”Sandor,” she calls after him, her mind newly cleansed of murder and revenge, seeing more clearly now than she had perhaps ever done. the man’s name hangs in the air until he turns around, looking at her. she swallows and continues, shaking her head, “don’t go.”

-”you know I have to-”

-”no,” Arya shakes her head firmer, more sure of herself now, “you don’t. neither of us do. Cersei and your brother will both be killed. it’s not safe for either of us to be here anymore.”

-”this is all I’ve ever wanted, girl,” his voice is not so much harsh, but he seems to have accepted what he says as the only truth in the world, “this is what I’ve waited my entire life for.”

-”but what if there’s something more? something else for us, somewhere else?”

-there’s a crash of a building falling outside, yet the city has never sounded so silent. Sandor clearly perks up at her suggestion, and his voice seems farther away as he asks, “like what?”

-she swallows hard, popping her ears. she doesn’t break his eye as she says the single word - the single name - that she knows holds most sway over him and his next option.

-”Sansa.”

-his face all but melts, as he softens entirely at the mention of her sister. her pretty sister, as he had called her so long ago now, who still unintentionally had her claws in him. Arya had known, of course, before that moment and during. especially now, afterwards, watching how his forever-steeled expression broke as he thought of her.

-”don’t be silly, girl,” Sandor shook his head a little, convincing himself more than Arya, “she’d never want anything to do with a man like me. your sister likes pretty knights and gallant soldiers, not half-crisped old nearly-knights. I’m better off ridding the world of Gregor.”

-as she thinks he’s about to leave - that that’s going to be their final interaction, before he heads off into certain doom - she calls to him once more. 

-”then whose cloak does she keep in her quarters?”

-all movements stop. he can only look on at her, mesmerised by her words, never having expected to hear them in his life, because Sansa wasn’t the kind of woman that fell for him. tavern wenches liked him because he was big and looked mean, and if they could bed him it would be one for the diaries. 

-Sansa, however… Sansa was a lady. Sansa was beauty, she was elegant. she was braver than he - alongside countless others - had ever given her credit for, and she’d become the smartest person he’d met. above Tyrion, above anyone. surely this intelligence meant she knew it was foolish to love a man like him.

-”how do I know you’re telling the truth?”

-Arya shrugged and offered him a half-smile, knowing she’d broken through to him, “I guess you don’t. not until you come back to Winterfell and see for yourself, anyway.”

-there’s a flicker of conflict on Sandor’s face, and for a moment Arya thinks he’s going to turn away after all and face death today as she’d managed to avoid for so very long. his mouth falls open, and he turns to face the steps he had been more than prepared to take mere moments ago.

-then, in the blink of an eye, he’s crossing the gap between them again, rejoining her where she stands, and he’s not quite willing to embarrass her enough to drag her by the collar out of the building that’s ready to give way at any moment, but he brushes past her in a way that she takes as a thank you.

-it’s good enough. she can’t stop herself from smiling as she follows him, at her own pace, yet keeping up with him simultaneously. 

-it’s going to be hard, she knows. she’s not a fool to think they’re going to get out of King’s Landing and all the way back up to Winterfell unscathed, but she can only hope that there’s enough pieces of Sandor left to deliver to her blissfully unaware, lovesick sister.

author’s note: pretty much taken from the actual scene, only with your prompt inserted! thanks for sending me this detailed idea anon, super lovely to imagine. the cloak!! of course Arya would learn of the cloak and piece it all together!! I’d have loved to watch her play cupid with these two, shame it won’t happen. hope you enjoy! :)

-”how do I know you’re telling the truth?”

-Arya shrugged and offered him a half-smile, knowing she’d broken through to him, “I guess you don’t. not until you come back to Winterfell and see for yourself, anyway.”

-there’s a flicker of conflict on Sandor’s face, and for a moment Arya thinks he’s going to turn away after all and face death today as she’d managed to avoid for so very long. his mouth falls open, and he turns to face the steps he had been more than prepared to take mere moments ago.

-then, in the blink of an eye, he’s crossing the gap between them again, rejoining her where she stands, and he’s not quite willing to embarrass her enough to drag her by the collar out of the building that’s ready to give way at any moment, but he brushes past her in a way that she takes as a thank you.

-it’s good enough. she can’t stop herself from smiling as she follows him, at her own pace, yet keeping up with him simultaneously. 

-it’s going to be hard, she knows. she’s not a fool to think they’re going to get out of King’s Landing and all the way back up to Winterfell unscathed, but she can only hope that there’s enough pieces of Sandor left to deliver to her blissfully unaware, lovesick sister.
trail.content:
author’s note: pretty much taken from the actual scene, only with your prompt inserted! thanks for sending me this detailed idea anon, super lovely to imagine. the cloak!! of course Arya would learn of the cloak and piece it all together!! I’d have loved to watch her play cupid with these two, shame it won’t happen. hope you enjoy! :)

-”Sandor,” she calls after him, her mind newly cleansed of murder and revenge, seeing more clearly now than she had perhaps ever done. the man’s name hangs in the air until he turns around, looking at her. she swallows and continues, shaking her head, “don’t go.”

-”you know I have to-”

-”no,” Arya shakes her head firmer, more sure of herself now, “you don’t. neither of us do. Cersei and your brother will both be killed. it’s not safe for either of us to be here anymore.”

-”this is all I’ve ever wanted, girl,” his voice is not so much harsh, but he seems to have accepted what he says as the only truth in the world, “this is what I’ve waited my entire life for.”

-”but what if there’s something more? something else for us, somewhere else?”

-there’s a crash of a building falling outside, yet the city has never sounded so silent. Sandor clearly perks up at her suggestion, and his voice seems farther away as he asks, “like what?”

-she swallows hard, popping her ears. she doesn’t break his eye as she says the single word - the single name - that she knows holds most sway over him and his next option.

-”Sansa.”

-his face all but melts, as he softens entirely at the mention of her sister. her pretty sister, as he had called her so long ago now, who still unintentionally had her claws in him. Arya had known, of course, before that moment and during. especially now, afterwards, watching how his forever-steeled expression broke as he thought of her.

-”don’t be silly, girl,” Sandor shook his head a little, convincing himself more than Arya, “she’d never want anything to do with a man like me. your sister likes pretty knights and gallant soldiers, not half-crisped old nearly-knights. I’m better off ridding the world of Gregor.”

-as she thinks he’s about to leave - that that’s going to be their final interaction, before he heads off into certain doom - she calls to him once more. 

-”then whose cloak does she keep in her quarters?”

-all movements stop. he can only look on at her, mesmerised by her words, never having expected to hear them in his life, because Sansa wasn’t the kind of woman that fell for him. tavern wenches liked him because he was big and looked mean, and if they could bed him it would be one for the diaries. 

-Sansa, however… Sansa was a lady. Sansa was beauty, she was elegant. she was braver than he - alongside countless others - had ever given her credit for, and she’d become the smartest person he’d met. above Tyrion, above anyone. surely this intelligence meant she knew it was foolish to love a man like him.

-”how do I know you’re telling the truth?”

-Arya shrugged and offered him a half-smile, knowing she’d broken through to him, “I guess you don’t. not until you come back to Winterfell and see for yourself, anyway.”

-there’s a flicker of conflict on Sandor’s face, and for a moment Arya thinks he’s going to turn away after all and face death today as she’d managed to avoid for so very long. his mouth falls open, and he turns to face the steps he had been more than prepared to take mere moments ago.

-then, in the blink of an eye, he’s crossing the gap between them again, rejoining her where she stands, and he’s not quite willing to embarrass her enough to drag her by the collar out of the building that’s ready to give way at any moment, but he brushes past her in a way that she takes as a thank you.

-it’s good enough. she can’t stop herself from smiling as she follows him, at her own pace, yet keeping up with him simultaneously. 

-it’s going to be hard, she knows. she’s not a fool to think they’re going to get out of King’s Landing and all the way back up to Winterfell unscathed, but she can only hope that there’s enough pieces of Sandor left to deliver to her blissfully unaware, lovesick sister.

summary: In the end one of the few true moments of pure happiness they had was shared with Sansa. Thanks to Sansa they knew peace, love,...
body: In the end one of the few true moments of pure happiness they had was shared with Sansa. Thanks to Sansa they knew peace, love, family. Now it’s Jon’s turn. IT HAS TO BE.

tags: A Song of Ice And Fire
summary: Game of Thrones Sanrion Discussion: The Music of Fairy Tales Okay so I am by no means an expert on music and I have only my ears...
caption:
Game of Thrones Sanrion Discussion: The Music of Fairy Tales

Okay so I am by no means an expert on music and I have only my ears to back me up, but hear me out.

This piece is called Truth. It’s the one we hear playing when Bran visits Lyanna and Rhaegal’s pasts as they are getting married. Possibly the closest thing to an in-universe example of True Love, Courtly Love and the perfect Fairy Tale romance.

The beginning of the piece shares the same melody/composition as two other pieces from earlier seasons called The Heir To Winterfell, and I am Hers and She is Mine, which coincidentally are the wedding vows of most Westerosi marriages.

The first bit of these pieces is also the melody played in this scene:

As well as the scene where Tyrion says “I won’t share your bed, not until you want me to”, and the scene where they find out that Robb and Catelyn Stark have been killed. And these are just off the top of my head Key Sanrion moments in which they play this song.

Which is unsurprising, I guess you might protest? After all, these are scenes referencing their marriage, or the fact that Sansa is the next Lady of Winterfell.

So now that their marriage arc has ended, this piece shouldn’t be brought back, right? Right?

Except they did. They brought it back in the moment in the newest season when Tyrion nearly gives up on reaching her, on breaking through her armor of courtesy and ice, as he had done it in King’s Landing, even as he speaks to her in the same tones as he speaks to Jaime, his family

They bring it up with rising drama, rather than melancholic, falling tones, just as Sansa makes the decision to trust Tyrion. Just as their entire arc circles back to the beginning, to when Sansa dares take the hand that Tyrion had offered her, because she finally sees him, because she finally knows him.

So they play the theme music of a fairy tale romance for two characters who spent their childhoods dreaming of fairy tales but saw all those dreams broken as they grew into adults? They play the music of fairy tales and marriage vows far beyond the time when they were actually married?

And still they play only the beginning?

The fact they brought it up again in this key moment; right before Tyrion is about to leave Winterfell, in the episode that makes it truly clear to Tyrion that Sansa trusts him and sees him as human rather than a monster, or his name, or his loyalties; in the episode right before he loses every other person who ever saw him as human…

that doesn’t make it feel like an ending, like a fairy tale that never was.

It makes it feel like the beginning.

After all, since they’ve reunited Sansa has spoken only with brutal honesty to Tyrion, and that has prompted him to open up to her with personal, emotional arguments, rather than generalisations or philosophies. And one of Sansa and Tyrion’s defining lines this season has been 

“It’s the truth. It’s the most heroic thing we can do now; look the truth in the face.”

So they never hit the dramatic height in this song, they only played the beginning. And if it is a beginning, that means there is a chance we get to see an ending as well, one that, miraculously, might give them the fairy tale they dreamt of as children.

The first bit of these pieces is also the melody played in this scene:

blog.name: samaraclegane
blog.title: fem
blog.description: caroline dhavernas is my wife. always feel free to send me prompts!

summary: Dany being angry that Sandor’s loyalty is to Sansa. Somehow Sansa saying “he’s mine” or Sandor saying “I’m hers” ( or something...
question: Dany being angry that Sandor’s loyalty is to Sansa. Somehow Sansa saying “he’s mine” or Sandor saying “I’m hers” ( or something like that) works in to it ☺️
answer:
author’s note: hi again! this is a pretty short one but I managed to do what you said in it. hopefully it’s not too brief/boring! thanks for the lovely prompt as always :)

-”you would betray me?” 

-Daenerys has a cold wash over her face. her beautiful features have turned stony, not that they’ve been anything but towards Sansa, but she usually likes to entertain new guests by pretending to feel. now, though, as she looks on at Sandor, the only thing she’s trying to instil into him is fear, in the highest degree.

-”after everything,” the Targaryen continues, obviously repeating the question to emphaise her disbelief at his stupidity, “you would choose to go against me?”

-”not choose to go against you, your grace,” Sandor remains relatively respectful, “choose to never kneel to another king or queen for as long as I live.”

-Daenerys laughs, but she doesn’t look amused. she sounds beyond offended as she quirks an eyebrow at him and remarks, “you seem perfectly happy to kneel before Lady Stark.”

-Sandor casts a look over at Sansa, who refuses to obey her childish instinct to blush and avoid his eye. she sees the corners of his lips tip upwards, and he sighs woefully as he admits aloud for the first time, “I’m hers.”

-when he turns back to Daenerys, he’s left with a sight of the queen gobsmacked. she shifts her eyes between the two, clearly having a meltdown trying to figure out how she missed something so incredibly monumental. Sansa’s not going to be the one to tell her nothing’s actually happened - not yet.

-”and I suppose this means you’ll be staying up north?” Daenerys demands an answer with her harsh tone.

-”aye,” Sandor’s tone of voice sounds bemused as he elaborates, and even though she can’t see his face Sansa knows he’s barely managing to contain a smile, “if the lady will have me.”

-Daenerys doesn’t address her by name, but rather tips her head to the side and looks at Sansa, requesting that she answers him then and there. Sansa’s voice squeaks a little as she pipes up.

-”yes, I should think that’ll be alright,” she carefully tip-toes around her next words, “if it please you, your grace.”

-”of course it doesn’t please me,” Daenerys looks defeated, but strokes one of the swords on the armrest of the Iron Throne and sighs, not looking at either of them as she resigns with a distant, “very well.”

-”thank you, your grace.” Sandor bows to her even though she’s not looking at him, then turns on his heel to face Sansa. 

-he’s wearing the widest grin she’s ever seen on anybody. he looks how she had so often imagined he did after a particularly brutal murder, or bloody war. the balls of his cheeks are painted red, the same shade of the crimson, exposed layers of tissue on the burnt side of his face. she smiles back.

-”thank you, your grace.”

-she turns to leave too, and they walk out of the hall together. after so many years playing the game of thrones, she knows this is far from over. Daenerys does not trust her, and she highly doubts she ever will, but for now there’s no more bloodshed at their doorstep. the cool breeze that blows through King’s Landing’s streets is refreshing, and the loose strands of her auburn hair blow back in the soft wind.

-for now, she can pretend it’s all fine. for now, she’s only got to focus on getting home - getting back to Winterfell - in one piece. oh, and she’s got to make sure Sandor travels safely, of course; she can’t have him dying now she’s finally got him.

reblog.comment:

trail.content_raw:
author’s note: hi again! this is a pretty short one but I managed to do what you said in it. hopefully it’s not too brief/boring! thanks for the lovely prompt as always :)

-”you would betray me?” 

-Daenerys has a cold wash over her face. her beautiful features have turned stony, not that they’ve been anything but towards Sansa, but she usually likes to entertain new guests by pretending to feel. now, though, as she looks on at Sandor, the only thing she’s trying to instil into him is fear, in the highest degree.

-”after everything,” the Targaryen continues, obviously repeating the question to emphaise her disbelief at his stupidity, “you would choose to go against me?”

-”not choose to go against you, your grace,” Sandor remains relatively respectful, “choose to never kneel to another king or queen for as long as I live.”

-Daenerys laughs, but she doesn’t look amused. she sounds beyond offended as she quirks an eyebrow at him and remarks, “you seem perfectly happy to kneel before Lady Stark.”

-Sandor casts a look over at Sansa, who refuses to obey her childish instinct to blush and avoid his eye. she sees the corners of his lips tip upwards, and he sighs woefully as he admits aloud for the first time, “I’m hers.”

-when he turns back to Daenerys, he’s left with a sight of the queen gobsmacked. she shifts her eyes between the two, clearly having a meltdown trying to figure out how she missed something so incredibly monumental. Sansa’s not going to be the one to tell her nothing’s actually happened - not yet.

-”and I suppose this means you’ll be staying up north?” Daenerys demands an answer with her harsh tone.

-”aye,” Sandor’s tone of voice sounds bemused as he elaborates, and even though she can’t see his face Sansa knows he’s barely managing to contain a smile, “if the lady will have me.”

-Daenerys doesn’t address her by name, but rather tips her head to the side and looks at Sansa, requesting that she answers him then and there. Sansa’s voice squeaks a little as she pipes up.

-”yes, I should think that’ll be alright,” she carefully tip-toes around her next words, “if it please you, your grace.”

-”of course it doesn’t please me,” Daenerys looks defeated, but strokes one of the swords on the armrest of the Iron Throne and sighs, not looking at either of them as she resigns with a distant, “very well.”

-”thank you, your grace.” Sandor bows to her even though she’s not looking at him, then turns on his heel to face Sansa. 

-he’s wearing the widest grin she’s ever seen on anybody. he looks how she had so often imagined he did after a particularly brutal murder, or bloody war. the balls of his cheeks are painted red, the same shade of the crimson, exposed layers of tissue on the burnt side of his face. she smiles back.

-”thank you, your grace.”

-she turns to leave too, and they walk out of the hall together. after so many years playing the game of thrones, she knows this is far from over. Daenerys does not trust her, and she highly doubts she ever will, but for now there’s no more bloodshed at their doorstep. the cool breeze that blows through King’s Landing’s streets is refreshing, and the loose strands of her auburn hair blow back in the soft wind.

-for now, she can pretend it’s all fine. for now, she’s only got to focus on getting home - getting back to Winterfell - in one piece. oh, and she’s got to make sure Sandor travels safely, of course; she can’t have him dying now she’s finally got him.

summary: So borrrrred of seeing Dany posts.
title: So borrrrred of seeing Dany posts.
body: The worst thing about an episode without Sansa. Oh well, only two more sleeps until I get to see my beautiful queen again.
